item.title: ICSID tribunal denies Perenco's request to dismiss Ecuador's counterclaims
item.description: In Perenco Ecuador Ltd v Republic of Ecuador (ICSID Case No ARB/08/6), an ICSID tribunal considered whether to grant the claimant's request that Ecuador's counterclaims be dismissed as inadmissible.

item.title: Live webinar: How can small and medium law firms leverage document automation for competitive advantage?
item.description: Registration is now open for our Thomson Reuters webinar on how small and medium law firms can leverage document automation for competitive advantage, which is taking place on 20 September 2017 at 1.00 pm.

item.title: Second Circuit Holds Uber Arbitration Clause Enforceable, Reversing District Court Decision
item.description: The United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit has reversed a lower court decision related to ongoing antitrust litigation that denied Uber's move to compel arbitration of the dispute, holding that the district court erred in concluding that notice of Uber's terms of service was not reasonably conspicuous, and therefore unenforceable.

item.title: UK government publishes position paper on cross-border civil judicial cooperation post-Brexit
item.description: The UK government has published its position paper on cross-border judicial cooperation in civil and family matters following its withdrawal from the EU. The position paper also outlines the UK's response to the European Commission's position paper on judicial cooperation in civil and commercial matters.

item.title: Astro/First Media: Leave to appeal granted in Hong Kong enforcement proceedings (Hong Kong Court of Final Appeal)
item.description: In Astro Nusantara International BV and others v PT First Media TBK [2017] HKCFA 50, the Court of Final Appeal of Hong Kong considered an application for leave to appeal against the Court of Appeal's judgment refusing an extension of time to apply to set aside orders for the enforcement of arbitral awards made in Singapore.

item.title: Tribunal does not exceed jurisdiction where its decision on issue submitted to arbitration was wrong (Singapore High Court)
item.description: In Quanzhou Sanhong Trading Ltd Liability Co Ltd v ADM Asia-Pacific Trading Pte Ltd [2017] SGHC 199, the Singapore High Court considered whether an arbitral tribunal exceeded its jurisdiction if it erred as to the governing law of the contract.

item.title: UK government publishes paper on enforcement and dispute resolution post-Brexit
item.description: The UK government has published a "future partnership paper" on enforcement and dispute resolution following the UK's withdrawal from the EU.

item.title: Section 44 English Arbitration Act 1996: order for sale of liened cargo (English Commercial Court)
item.description: In Dainford Navigation Inc v PDVSA Petroleo SA "Moscow Stars" [2017] EWHC 2150 (Comm), the English Commercial Court considered an application for an order for the sale of cargo under section 44 of the English Arbitration Act 1996 (AA 1996).

item.title: DC District Court denies discovery request by former Yukos shareholders
item.description: In In re Application for an Order Pursuant to 28 U.S.C. � 1782 to Conduct Discovery for Use in a Foreign Proceeding, No. 1:17-MC-01466-BAH (D.D.C. Aug. 18, 2017), the US District Court for the District of Columbia considered whether to grant a discovery request made by the former Yukos shareholders against Baker Botts.

item.title: S�o Paulo State Court of Appeal: arbitration clause binds assignee of credit assignment agreement
item.description: In Comexport Companhia de Com�rcio Exterior v Agro Hemar Ltda, Appeal n. 1033180-05.2015.8.26.0506, the Court of Appeals of the State Court of S�o Paulo considered the binding nature of an arbitration clause in a credit assignment agreement.

item.title: Arbitration news round-up to 23 August 2017
item.description: Developments that may be of interest to arbitration practitioners for the week to 23 August 2017

item.title: Arbitration blogs: arbitration in Africa and space arbitration
item.description: Two new posts have been published on the Practical Law Arbitration blog. Abdul Jinadu at Keating Chambers considers the rise of arbitration in Africa. Simon Maynard and Katherine Jonckheere at Three Crowns LLP examine the suitability of international arbitration as a method of resolution for disputes over the mining of natural resources in space.

item.title: PRC court refuses to enforce SIAC award made under expedited procedure
item.description: The Shanghai No.1 Intermediate Court has refused to enforce a Singapore International Arbitration Centre (SIAC) award made under expedited procedure in the SIAC Rules 2013.

item.title: Development of commercial law justifies determination of hypothetical question of law (English Commercial Court)
item.description: In Dry Log Bulk Carriers v Phaethon International Co SA [2016] EWHC 3798 (Comm), the English Commercial Court considered an appeal under section 69 of the English Arbitration Act 1996 (AA 1996) from an award made by two maritime arbitrators.

item.title: PRC court enforces HKIAC award in favour of Australian gold mining company
item.description: In Stonewall Resources Ltd v Shandong Qixing Iron Tower Co Ltd (unpublished), the Beijing No. 4 Intermediate People's Court considered whether to enforce a Hong Kong International Arbitration Centre (HKIAC) award relating to a breach of a share sale agreement.

item.title: Singapore High Court affirms pro-arbitration stance in stay applications
item.description: In BASF Intertrade AG Singapore Branch v H&C S Holding Pte Ltd [2017] SGHCR 10, the Singapore High Court considered whether to stay court proceedings in favour of arbitration under section 6 of the International Arbitration Act (IAA) and under its inherent powers of case management.

item.title: German Federal Court of Justice on conclusion of arbitration agreement based on trade usage
item.description: In Docket No I ZB 69/16, the German Federal Court of Justice considered the prerequisites for a binding arbitration agreement, including whether an arbitration agreement can be concluded by implication based on a trade usage, that is, where it is common for participants of a particular trade or industry to use arbitration as a method of resolving disputes.

item.title: High Level Committee submits report on reforms to institutional arbitration in India
item.description: Following its establishment in January 2017 by the Indian Department of Legal Affairs, Ministry of Law and Justice, the High Level Committee has submitted its three-part report on suggested reforms to arbitration in India.

item.title: Swiss Supreme Court finds that challenge to Yukos Capital jurisdictional award is premature
item.description: In decision 4A_98/2017, the Swiss Supreme Court considered whether a challenge brought by the Russian Federation against an interim award on jurisdiction rendered in a dispute with Yukos Capital was premature, as the arbitral tribunal had ruled on only three of five jurisdictional objections, reserving its decision on the two remaining objections for the final award.

item.title: Arbitration news round-up to 16 August 2017
item.description: Developments that may be of interest to arbitration practitioners for the week to 16 August 2017.

item.title: DIFC Courts announce sustained growth in first half of 2017
item.description: The Dubai International Financial Centre (DIFC) Courts has announced sustained growth in the first half of 2017.

item.title: Arbitration blogs: Women in arbitration and UAE Federal Arbitration Law
item.description: Two new posts have been published on the Practical Law Arbitration blog. Continuing our series on women in arbitration, Judith Gill QC at Allen & Overy discusses women in arbitration and its future. Dr Gordon Blanke at DWF (Middle East) LLP examines the implications of the United Arab Emirates (UAE) Federal Arbitration Law, which looks set to become a reality, in the second of three related blog posts.

item.title: Commercial Court of Moscow refuses to enforce series of Ukrainian awards on grounds of public policy
item.description: In a series of decisions (Case No. A40-4668/17-83-29 and others), the Commercial Court of Moscow considered whether to refuse enforcement of a number of Ukrainian arbitration awards on the grounds that the awards violated public policy.

item.title: SIAC opens second representative office in India
item.description: The Singapore International Arbitration Centre (SIAC) has announced the opening of a second representative office in India.

item.title: Court Clarifies Delegation of Arbitrability in UNCITRAL Arbitrations: Fifth Circuit
item.description: In Brittania-U Nigeria, Ltd. v. Chevron USA, Inc., the US Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit held that an agreement that provides for arbitration under the United Nations Commission on International Trade Law (UNCITRAL) Arbitration Rules constitutes a clear and unmistakable delegation to the arbitrator to decide arbitrability.

item.title: Indian Supreme Court rules ineligible arbitrator cannot appoint replacement even where such power exists in arbitration agreement
item.description: In TRF Ltd v Energo Engineering Projects Ltd (Civil Appeal No. 5306 of 2017), the Indian Supreme Court considered whether an arbitrator, who is ineligible to act, is able to appoint a nominee to act as a replacement, where such a power to appoint was provided for under the arbitration agreement. The court also considered whether a challenge to a nominated replacement can be made by an application under section 11 of the Indian Arbitration and Conciliation Act 1996 or before the arbitrator.

item.title: Arbitration news round-up to 9 August 2017
item.description: Developments that may be of interest to arbitration practitioners for the week to 9 August 2017.

item.title: Milan Chamber of Arbitration releases statistics promoting gender diversity
item.description: The Milan Chamber of Arbitration (CAM) has published its statistics on gender diversity in arbitral appointments for 2015 and 2016.

item.title: No Wholly Groundless Exception in Determining Delegation of Arbitrability: Eleventh Circuit
item.description: In Jones v. Waffle House, Inc., the US Court of Appeals for the Eleventh Circuit declined to adopt a "wholly groundless" exception when enforcing arbitration agreements with clear intent to arbitrate gateway issues.

item.title: Arbitration blogs: Women in arbitration and LCA-YAN's arbitration moot competition
item.description: Two new posts have been published on the Practical Law Arbitration blog. Continuing our series on women in arbitration, Judith Gill QC at Allen & Overy discusses arbitration practice and procedure. Ajokpaoghene Utake at Babalakin & Co Legal Practitioners reflects on the maiden edition of the Lagos Court of Arbitration Young Arbitrators Network (LCA-YAN) moot competition.
